page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS IN LANGHOLM
page.content: THE OLD LANGHOLM {RAILWAY }WAS A SINGLE TRACK BRANCH LINE.THE RAILWAY WAS BUILT IN 1864 AND THE LAST TRAIN TO LEAVE LANGHOLM WAS ON THE 13th OF JUNE 1964.NOW THERE IS A PLAQUE AT TOWNFOOT WHERE THE PLATFORM USE TO BE. THE MAIN {ROAD }IN LANGHOLM IS THE {A7 WHICH RUNS FROM CARLISLE(TO THE SOUTH) TO EDINBURGH(TO THE NORTH).ANOTHER ROAD IN LANGHOLM IS THE {B709 }WHICH STARTS AT THE TOWNHEAD BRIDGE AND LEADS OUT PAST ESKDALEMUIR.THE {B7068} BRANCHES OFF THIS ROAD TO LOCKERBIE. A {SURVEY }WAS TAKEN ON THURSDAY THE 6th OF JUNE 1985 AT THE POST OFFICE ON THE A7.BETWEEN 10:30a.m.AND 11:00a.m. THERE WERE 100 CARS,28 VANS,22 LORRIES,2 TRACTORS,6 BIKES AND 1 COACH.SOME PEOPLE IN LANGHOLM WOULD LIKE A BY_PASS BUILT BECAUSE OF THE LARGE LORRIES GOING THROUGH LANGHOLM HIGH STREET.
